channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: English words of Yiddish origin. https://t.co/a4jyyBtUW2

I can't believe all the crazy bs swirling around the Knicks right now. Here's the deal. We have a really interesting team, we're going to get really emotionally involved with them next season. We're going to *love* rooting for them, win or lose. So stop kvetching and relax. ;-)
A quote from the Internet History podcast sums up pretty concisely what non-technical people should know to understand why podcasting is so special. https://t.co/LXXZqvafZa
I was looking through some archives and came across this picture of Bill Gates and Steve Jobs probably taken in the 80s or early 90s. A lot of time has passed. https://t.co/TwGOTtf0Vw
Lake Mead, once the largest water reservoir in the US, now little more than a graveyard. https://t.co/IJZZeyqTR7
How William Olson, Right-Wing Lawyer, Pitched Trump on a 2020 Election Plot. https://t.co/c8zcYVdJ5g
"Looking for a job when youâ€™re in your 50s is sobering. 'People donâ€™t want to see their moms in the office,' one friend told me." https://t.co/wNf9r0OTnr

1/2 I want Biden to step back after the election and let the Democrats have a great primary campaign where we really discuss, as a country, what our options are going forward. Not limited to things considered too daring, like expanding the court.
2/2 It's clear Biden will not do what we need. But that's okay, his greatest contribution would be to create a stage for the next generation of leaders to work things out, along with Bernie Sanders and others.
Arno Schmidt was my great-uncle. https://t.co/ZqBIuk8lC8
@jeffjarvis @danalacey @ElieNYC That is whatâ€™s on the way to happening. Substack led the first exodus. They must be paying our mentor big $$ to incentivize him to stay at the Nation.

@jeffjarvis @danalacey @ElieNYC I have a contrarian point of view. I think if one of these pubs decided to make it pay-as-you-go it would be so popular with readers that it would make the others want to be part of something like this. If I had the means I would buy one of the pubs just to do this.
@jeffjarvis @danalacey @ElieNYC By the way itâ€™s very much like what substack is doing.
@jeffjarvis @GuySie @ElieNYC Somethings got to give. This situation is untenable.
@BarbMcQuade @hugolowell @samstein @VelshiMSNBC Obviously theyâ€™re lying.
@GuySie @jeffjarvis @ElieNYC Itâ€™s not up to startups to make this work. Itâ€™s up to the publications.

@danalacey @jeffjarvis @ElieNYC I hate the term micropayments because it implies that thereâ€™s very little money in it. The technology should apply across all publications like an EZ-pass for news. Just because it didnâ€™t work once doesnâ€™t mean it doesnâ€™t work now.

@jeffjarvis @ElieNYC Maybe for some pubs, like the NYT and WP, unbundling would result in lost revenue. But the rest, like The Nation, need a way for readers to get hooked. I canâ€™t imagine the current approach is working for them.
Okay, the Knicks should stand pat, tell the Jazz to fuck off. I like our team. So many wonderful young players. Then do a big deal mud season or next summer. https://t.co/wdnnjmltmh

@jeffjarvis Why canâ€™t they put up an interface that lets us pay per article read. Why should I have to pay for a subscription to The Nation just to read @ElieNYC? I can go to a Mets game without buying a season ticket. I can take the 7 train to Flushing without paying for a monthly pass.
Van Morrison: Domino. https://t.co/n397AIM6vx
@leolaporte Hey Leo and friends! ðŸ˜€
The Dems are the problem now. https://t.co/URTlI3Esfj

Postlight's Mercury Parser extracts the bits that humans care about from any URL you give it. That includes article content, titles, authors, published dates, excerpts, lead images, and more. https://t.co/ZMGu8oeDUJ
@gruber that looks really useful. i like that it runs in node.js, which is where all my stuff runs too. ;-)
I really like the way the Jan 6 committee uses the net. https://t.co/LQtRmQvxbi
